1.computerLibraryDescription: From the Sonos app on your computer, go to Manage ➔ Music Library Settings and add the folder your music is stored in. (It's usually in your computer's Music folder.)
1.computerLibraryInstruction: Once everything syncs, choose Music Library from the Menu to browse and play your collection.
1.computerLibraryNote: Note: If your collection is big, syncing it to your app may take up to 15 minutes.
1.musicServicesBullet2: Choose any service you'd like to add or try out.
1.musicServicesDescription: Add your own or try something new.
1.title: Add your music
1.tuneInDescription: Explore more than 100,000 free online stations and podcasts.

10.description: When new software becomes available, you'll see Update Now on the More tab.
10.header: Sonos regularly adds new features so your listening experience is always improving.
10.tapIt: Just tap it to get the latest update (the music will pause briefly).
10.title: Install Sonos updates
10.wantToCheck: Want to manually check for updates?

1011.goToEnhanceTVSound: Go to our "Enhance your TV sound" tip to learn more.
1011.selectRoomEQ: Select the room your speaker is in.
1011.title: Custom tune a speaker

1013.chooseRoomSurround: Choose the room with your home theater speaker and surrounds.
1013.learnMoreHomeTheater: Learn more about Sonos home theater setups on our website.
1013.nightSound: Boosts quieter TV sounds, lowers loud ones.
1013.sectionTitle2: Adjust surround settings for TV and music
1013.selectRoom: Select the room with your home theater speaker.
1013.setLevels: Set the TV and Music levels to your preference.
1013.speechEnhancement: Makes TV dialog easier to understand.
1013.tapIcon: Tap the icon on the Now Playing screen.
1013.title: Enhance your TV sound

11.goToEnhanceTVSound: Go to our "Enhance your TV sound" tip to learn more.
11.selectRoom: Select the room with the speaker you want to tune.
11.selectRoomEQ: Select the room your speaker is in.
11.smallAdjustmentsIntro: Still want to make some small adjustments?
11.title: Custom tune a speaker
11.trueplayIntro: With an iPhone or iPad you can fine-tune your speaker for the best sound possible. In any room.

12.microphone: Tap to turn the microphone on and off. When the mic light is off, voice control is off and you can't use Alexa.
12.playPause:
Tap once to start the music. Tap again to pause.
Tap twice to skip to the next song. Three times to jump back one song. Press and hold to add the music playing in another room.
12.pressAndHold: Tap once to play or pause. Press and hold to add the music playing in another room.
12.sigdetailVolume: (: :) Volume Control: Tap left to lower the volume, tap right to turn it up.
12.sigdetailVolumePlay5: (: :) Volume Control: Tap left to lower the volume, tap right to turn it up. If the Play:5 is placed vertically, tap above the Sonos logo to turn it up; tap below the logo to turn it down.
12.swipe: Swipe right to hear the next song; swipe left to hear the previous one.
12.swipePlay5: Swipe right to hear the next song; swipe left to hear the previous one. If the Play:5 is placed vertically, swipe up for the next song; down for the previous song.
12.tapVolumeDown: Tap to turn the volume down.
12.tapVolumeUp: Tap to turn the volume up.
12.title: Use touch controls
12.touchPlayPause: Tap once to play or pause. Press and hold to add the music playing in another room.

13.adjustBalance: Adjust and balance your setup for the best sound possible.
13.chooseRoomSurround: Choose the room with your home theater speaker and surrounds.
13.goToCustomTuneTip: Go to our "Custom tune a speaker" tip to learn more.
13.learnMoreHomeTheater: Learn more about Sonos home theater setups on our website.
13.nightSound: Boosts quieter TV sounds, lowers loud ones.
13.sectionTitle2: Adjust surround settings for TV and music
13.sectionTitle3: Trueplay tune your Sonos home theater
13.selectRoom: Select the room with your home theater speaker.
13.setLevels: Set the TV and Music levels to your preference.
13.speechEnhancement: Makes TV dialog easier to understand.
13.tapIcon: Tap the icon on the Now Playing screen.
13.title: Enhance your TV sound

14.placeSpeaker: Place your new speaker where you want it and plug it in.
14.title: Add another speaker
14.waitForLight: Wait until the light on your speaker flashes green.

15.intro: Turn two Sonos One, Play:1, or Play:5 speakers into separate left and right channels.
15.learnMore: Learn more about stereo pairs on our website.
15.selectSpeaker: Select a speaker and tap Create Stereo Pair.
15.title: Create a stereo pair

16.connectToLineIn: Connect the turntable's audio output to a Play:5 line-in port, or to the audio-in jacks on a Connect or Connect:Amp.
16.intro: Send sound from a pre-amped turntable to a Sonos speaker.
16.learnMore: Learn more about line-in on our website.
16.selectSource: Go to Browse ➔ Line-In and select your source.
16.title: Play vinyl on Sonos

18.disclaimerText: See if Amazon Alexa is available in your country on our website.
18.introText: Play and control music with a Sonos speaker that has Amazon Alexa built in. Or wirelessly connect an Amazon Echo device to any of your existing Sonos speakers.
18.setUpVoiceControl: Go to "Set up voice control on your Sonos speaker" to learn more.
18.setupAmazonEcho: Go to "Set up your Amazon Echo device with Sonos" to learn more.
18.title: Control Sonos with Amazon Alexa

19.disclaimerText: See if Amazon Alexa is available in your country on our website.
19.introText: Use a combination of your voice and the Sonos app to play and control your music.
19.section1Title: Ask Alexa to play music from the following services:
19.section2Text1: Make sure your music services are set up in both the Sonos and Alexa apps.
19.section2Text2: Use your voice to start and control music on Amazon Music (Prime or Unlimited), TuneIn Radio, Pandora, or iHeartRadio.
19.section2Text3: Use the app to start music on Spotify, Apple Music or another streaming service, then use your voice to control it. You can skip or replay songs, pause the music, adjust the volume and more.
19.section2Title: Over time we’ll be adding more services and skills (some voice and music services might not be available in your country).
19.title: Music services and voice control

2.group: Or you can tap Rooms ➔ Group to do the same thing.
2.imageText: If you're on the Now Playing screen, just tap to choose where you want the music to play.
2.introText: Play music in any or every room.
2.title: Play music throughout your home
2.tvSound: Got a home theater speaker? You can send TV sound to other rooms the same way.

21.title: Set parental controls
21.turnOnParentalControls: Turn on Parental Controls to restrict access to explicit content.

22.bullet1: To change what's playing, tap a room and pick a different song from My Sonos, Browse, or Search.
22.bullet2: To change where it's playing, tap Group.
22.roomsIconText: Tap to see what's playing in your rooms.
22.title: See what's playing

23.castButtonIcon: When you've got music playing in the Pandora app, just choose the Cast button to send it to Sonos.
23.disclaimerText: (Some music services might not be available in your country.)
23.introText: If you're a Pandora user, you can send whatever you're playing on Pandora straight to any Sonos speaker.
23.title: Play directly from Pandora

24.disclaimerText: See if Amazon Alexa is available in your country on our website.
24.introText: Use your Amazon Echo Dot or other Echo device to play and control the music on any Sonos speaker.
24.number1: Set up your Amazon Alexa device.
24.number4: Search for Sonos and choose the Sonos skill.
24.title: Set up your Amazon Echo device with Sonos

25.disclaimerText: See if Amazon Alexa is available in your country on our website.
25.introText: Make sure you’ve got the Alexa app before you start.
25.makeChanges: You’ll make some changes to both the Sonos and Alexa apps during setup - we’ll guide you through it.
25.number2: Go to More ➔ Voice Services and follow the prompts.
25.title: Set up voice control on your Sonos speaker

26.bullet1: Keep the mic light on and your speaker’s always ready to respond to Alexa’s wake word.
26.bullet2: If the mic light is off, you can still use voice commands. Just press and hold the mic button to talk to Alexa—no need to start with a wake word. When you release the button, voice control turns off again.
26.disclaimerText: See if Amazon Alexa is available in your country on our website.
26.introText: If your speaker has voice control, you can turn the microphone on and off—just touch the mic button. When the mic light is off, voice control is off and you can’t use Alexa.
26.text1: If you don’t have a voice service installed, the microphone is inactive.
26.title: How do I turn off the microphone?

28.bullet1Text: Group and ungroup AirPlay 2-compatible Sonos speakers right from the AirPlay menu. (Compatible Sonos speakers include Sonos One, Beam, Play:5, and Playbase.)
28.bullet2Text: Use the Sonos app to add your other Sonos speakers to the group and they’ll stream AirPlay too. You can keep these speakers grouped with your AirPlay 2-compatible Sonos speakers.
28.bullet3Text: Press and hold the Play button on any Sonos speaker to add the music that’s playing in another room.
28.introText: Enjoy your favorite apps out loud. Play sound from your iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV straight to Sonos with AirPlay. Listen to Apple Music on your Sonos One. Watch a YouTube or Netflix video and enjoy the sound on Sonos.
28.learnMoreText: Learn more about using AirPlay with Sonos on our website.
28.title: Use AirPlay with Sonos

29.bullet1Text: Open the Home app and tap + or Add Accessory.
29.bullet2Text: Choose "Don’t Have a Code or Can’t Scan?"
29.bullet3Text: Tap the speaker you want to add.
29.bullet4Text: Pick the same room name that’s used in the Sonos app.
29.footnoteText: *AirPlay 2-compatible Sonos speakers include Sonos One, Beam, Play:5, and Playbase.
29.introText: Just add your AirPlay 2-compatible* Sonos speakers to the Apple Home app and then use an iPhone, iPad or Apple TV to ask Siri to play music (currently limited to Apple Music).
29.learnMoreText: Learn more about using Siri with Sonos on our website.
29.title: Use Siri to control Apple Music

3.bullet1Text: Tap Search to find a song you like.
3.bullet3Text: Select an existing playlist or tap More Options (⋯) ➔ New Playlist to start a new one.
3.fromNowPlayingText: If you're on the Now Playing screen, it's even easier. Add the song that's playing by tapping More Options (⋯) ➔ Add Song to Sonos Playlist.
3.title: Build and save playlists

30.body1: Easily add music from another room without having to pick up your phone. Just press and hold the Play button on any Sonos speaker to group it with a room that’s already playing.
30.body2: If different music is playing in different rooms, press and hold the Play button until you hear the sound you want.
30.title: Group rooms with a touch

31.bullet1Text: Add a Sub for room-filling bass.
31.bullet2Text: Add a pair of Sonos One, Play:1, or Play:5 speakers as rear surrounds.
31.bullet3Text: Add both a Sub and pair of surrounds to immerse yourself in full 5.1 home theater sound.
31.learnMore: Learn more about home theater setup on our website.
31.title: Expand your home theater

32.body1: Pair your Amazon Fire TV devices with Beam and you can play, pause, and search for content without reaching for your remote.
32.learnMore: Learn more about using Amazon Fire TV devices with Beam.
32.title: Control Fire TV content with your voice

4.bulletText1: Tap Edit to delete songs or rearrange the order.
4.bulletText2: Save the queue as a Sonos playlist so you can listen to it again.
4.descriptionText: A queue is created any time you play a song, album, or playlist. When one song ends, the next one starts.
4.tapToSeeQueue: Tap to see your music queue.
4.title: The music queue

5.intro: For super smooth transitions between songs, tap More Options (⋯) on the Now Playing screen and turn on Crossfade.
5.intro2: At the top of the queue screen:
5.repeat: Tap to repeat the entire queue. Tap again to repeat the current song. Tap once more to turn off repeat.
5.shuffle: Tap to randomly shuffle song order. Tap again and you're back to the original flow.
5.title: Crossfade, Shuffle, Repeat

6.introText: If you're a Spotify Premium user, you can send whatever you're playing on Spotify straight to any Sonos speaker. With just a tap.
6.secureRegistration: You'll need a Sonos account to use this feature. Go to More ➔ Settings ➔ Sonos Account to set one up. (If you don't see Sonos Account, your Sonos system needs to be updated.)
6.spotifyInstruction: When you've got music playing in the Spotify app, just choose DEVICES AVAILABLE to send it to Sonos.
6.title: Play directly from Spotify

7.bullet1Text: Wake up to different songs, radio stations, or playlists on different days.
7.bullet2Text: Have your favorite songs rocking when you come home from work.
7.bullet3Text: Schedule Sonos to play for a few hours every night while you're on vacation.
7.catchSomeMoreDescription: Turn on Snooze Alerts when you set an alarm.
7.catchSomeMoreText: Want to catch a few more Z's?
7.sleepToMusicDescription: Sonos can shut off automatically. Tap More Options (⋯) on the Now Playing screen to set a sleep timer.
7.sleepToMusicText: Love to fall asleep to music?
7.title: Set a musical alarm

8.addFromNowPlaying: Note: You can also favorite a song or station directly from the Now Playing screen by tapping More Options (⋯) ➔ Add to My Sonos. (Songs on your mobile device can’t be saved as favorites.)
8.editInstructions: Go to My Sonos and tap Edit. You can also edit the contents of a category in My Sonos (such as Albums, Playlists, or Songs), by tapping See All, then More Options (⋯) at the top of the screen.
8.introText: Save your favorite songs, stations, or collections like "New Releases" to My Sonos and you'll never have to search for them again.
8.tapWhenBrowsing: Tap More Options (⋯) when you are searching or browsing music.
8.title: Save your favorites to My Sonos

9.createAccount: If you don't see Sonos Account, your Sonos system needs to be updated.
9.intro: An account lets you add more speakers, get new features, and safely and securely integrate with your streaming apps.
9.navInstructions: Access your account anytime by selecting More ➔ Settings ➔ Sonos Account.
9.title: Your Sonos account
